reporting-org.narrative: The Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and Malaria

title.narrative: Scaling up the fight against HIV and AIDS in Namibia

description.narrative: Based on the UNAIDS 2008 Report, Namibia has one the world’s highest HIV and AIDS infection rates with an adult HIV prevalence rate of 15.3 percent. Being the second most sparsely populated country in the world, providing comprehensive HIV and AIDS services to rural population requires a fully decentralized, community-based approach with strong policies and leadership from the central level. The current grant is implementing the Rolling Continuation Channel (RCC) program of the Round 2 proposal along with the national Principal Recipient (PR). The program aims to reduce the impact of HIV and AIDS through an integrated approach to prevention, treatment, care and support, and mitigation of the impact on the affected populations. Prevention activities include strengthening of community based organizations, social mobilization, condom distribution, voluntary counselling and testing, and prevention of mother-to-child transmission (PMTCT). Treatment activities focus on the roll-out of anti-retroviral treatment (ART), care and support activities on the provision of home-based care and mitigation activities provide support to orphans and vulnerable children (OVC).

Coverage / Output indicator for NMB-202-G07-H

HCW Other-1: Number of persons working in Civil Society Organizations providing public health services at the community level who are trained in Project management and CCE Community Capacity Enhancement methodologies.
KP-other 1: Number of inmates who have been reached with individual or small group HIV prevention interventions (social and behaviour change programs)
TCS Other-2: Number of chronically ill people living with HIV who receive home based care
YP-other 2: # of adolescent girls and young women aged 10-24 years reached with small group or individual social and behaviour change programs.
YP-other 1: # of youths aged 10-24 years reached with small group or individual social and behaviour change programs
Percentage of orphaned and vulnerable children aged 0–17 years whose households received free basic external support in caring for the child according to national guidelines
GP Other-2: Number of men and women who received an HIV test and know their results through door to door HCT strategy (including repeat testers)
PMTCT Other-1: # of positive women who are visited at least once at home between 1 and 8 weeks post-partum by community worker
MSM Other-1: Number of men who have sex with men who have been reached with individual or small group HIV prevention interventions that address the drivers of the epidemic
TCS Other-1: Number of people living with HIV/AIDS who receive care and support services
GP Other-1: # of people aged 25 years and older reached with small group or individual social and behaviour change programs
Impact indicator for NMB-202-G07-H
Percentage of men who have sex with men who are living with HIV
Number of AIDS-related deaths per 100,000 population
Percentage of sex workers who are living with HIV
Estimated percentage of children newly infected with HIV from mother-to-child transmission among women living with HIV delivering in the past 12 months
HIV I-other 1: Percentage of young women and men aged 15-24 years who are HIV infected
Outcome indicator for NMB-202-G07-H
HIV O Other-9: % of circumcised men aged 15-49 who had higher risk sex and used a condom with last non cohabiting partner in the past 12 months
HIV O Other-8: Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 years ever tested for HIV and received their results - Males
HIV O Other-2: Percentage of women and men aged 15–49 years who have had more than one sexual partner in the past 12 months reporting the use of a condom during their last sexual intercourse - Males

HIV O Other-1: Percentage of women and men aged 15–49 years who have had more than one sexual partner in the past 12 months reporting the use of a condom during their last sexual intercourse - Females
HIV O Other-7: Percentage of women and men aged 15-49 years ever tested for HIV and received their results - Females
HIV O Other-5: Percentage of adults and children with HIV known to be on treatment 24 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy - Children
HIV O Other-6: Percentage of adults and children with HIV known to be on treatment 24 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy - Adults
HIV O Other-4: Percentage of adults and children with HIV known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy - Adults
HIV O Other-3: Percentage of adults and children with HIV known to be on treatment 12 months after initiation of antiretroviral therapy - Children
Percentage of men reporting the use of a condom the last time they had anal sex with a male partner
Percentage of sex workers reporting the use of a condom with their most recent client
